meanings.definition: A group of countries, organizations, or people with a common purpose or interest.
meanings.sent1: The bloc of nations worked together for peace.
meanings.sent2: The trade bloc boosted economic growth for all members.
meanings.sent3: The bloc of friends decided to throw a surprise party.
meanings.sent4: Their unity formed a strong bloc against external threats.
meanings.sent5: The bloc's mission was to protect the environment at all costs.

meanings.definition: A group of voters or politicians who share common goals.
meanings.sent1: The voting bloc supported the new education policy.
meanings.sent2: The political bloc aimed to improve healthcare for all.
meanings.sent3: The bloc of students campaigned for longer recess breaks.
meanings.sent4: Their alliance created a powerful voting bloc in the election.
meanings.sent5: The bloc's unity led to positive changes in the community.
